page.title: 19LIFE IN SHIELDAIG
page.content: SHIELDAIG HAS SEEN MANY CHANGES IN THE PAST FEW YEARS. ONLY IN THE LAST TWENTY YEARS HAS TRAVELLING NORTH AND SOUTH ALONG THE COAST BEEN POSSIBLE WITH THE OPENING OF ROADS TO TORRIDON TO THE NORTH AND APPLECROSS TO THE SOUTH. THE ONLY ROAD WAS INLAND TO LOCHCARRON. THESE WERE JOINED ONLY BY TRACKS. MOST TRADE WITH THE VILLAGES WAS BY BOAT. NOW EVERYONE ENJOYS THE CONVENIENCE OF THE MOTOR CAR, WHICH ALSO BRINGS ONE OF THE MAIN INDUSTRIES _ TOURISTS. THE VILLAGE IS BUSTLING IN THE SUMMER MONTHS, CONTRASTING WITH THE QUIET OF THE WINTER. TOURISTS BRING AFFLUENCE AND WORK TO MANY HIGHLANDERS AND SHIELDAIG IS NOW A PLACE WHERE PEOPLE COME TO LIVE AND WORK FROM ALL OVER BRITAIN.
